name: Mogonaló: The Rainbow Serpent
description:
/Get hypnotized by Mogonaló, the mythical rainbow serpent from the Qom people/

Qom people are one of the largest indigenous groups in Argentina who historically inhabited the region known today as the Pampas of the Central Chaco. In their culture, Mogonaló is a huge serpent related to the powers of the underworld.

When the climate is mild it lives under the water or in the large ant hills, when changing places it emanates a colored vapor that originates the rainbow.

The rainbow serpent is also part of Australian, Inca and Mesoamerican mythology. That's why I decided to represent it in the ouroboric position (eating it's own tail) since this symbol is also universal and can be found in Nordic, South American, Middle Eastern and Indian cultures.

𝘛𝘏𝘖̈𝘙 (@𝘷𝘫𝘵𝘩𝘰𝘳) 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘵𝘩𝘦 '𝘖𝘶𝘳 𝘔𝘺𝘵𝘩𝘴' 𝘦𝘹𝘩𝘪𝘣𝘪𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯 𝘩𝘦𝘭𝘥 𝘣𝘺 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘊𝘏𝘌𝘕 𝘢𝘳𝘵𝘪𝘴𝘵 𝘤𝘰𝘭𝘭𝘦𝘤𝘵𝘪𝘷𝘦
